file_content.text: I hope you found my information useful.
Freighter Mynock Fodder 62009, please stand by for landing clearance.
I'm looking for a Devaronian named Tyresius Lokai. Got any record of him?
Scanning databanks. One moment please....
Records indicate only one Devaronian present at the spaceport--a merchant named Gellar Roing.
Bet you anything Gellar Roing is an alias for Tyresius Lokai.
Sounds right.
Where can we find this "Gellar Roing," droid?
I don't need your help.
It's not an opinion, it's a hunch--and you know I'm right.
Perhaps Gellar Roing knows Tyresius Lokai?
Where can I find this Devaronian merchant?
Let's find out.
The chances of two Devaronians on Tatooine are slim.
I wouldn't bet against it.
Given the rarity of the species, I calculate the odds as approximately one in twelve billion.
You're an idiot.
My apologies. Providing clues is not one of my functions.
Gellar Roing's vessel is awaiting departure clearance in docking bay sixty-four. Do you wish for me to contact him?
I want my visit to be a surprise.
No, I'll handle it.
Very well, but he is scheduled for takeoff soon.
Where'd this guy get his starship?
Tell me about the ship.
The vessel was purchased today from a Rodian bounty hunter. Unfortunately, the transaction record is incomplete.
That ship isn't going anywhere, got it?
Don't let him leave.
I cannot revoke Gellar Roing's flight clearance, but I do list six vessels in line ahead of him.
If you hurry, you might catch him.
Please excuse me, but monitoring space traffic requires all of my attention.
